CatDescriptText: Mrs. June Bryant, 21 Granville Street, and Mrs. Joan Lett, 1845 Boulevard of the Allies, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1957, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that parents should be imprisoned for the unlawful acts of their children (under 18 years of age)?" Mrs. June Bryant's answer reads: "No, because the parent's can't be with the children all the time." Mrs. Joan Lett's answer reads: "No, because you can bring a child up in the right way and in some instances, the child still does wrong. Certainly you can't blame the parents when this happens."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of June Bryant wearing hoop earrings, dark knit sweater with diamond design, and light colored coat, and Joan Lett wearing open double breasted coat, standing in parking lot with two young boys, in front of automobiles and brick building with sign that reads "Meyers Plumbing & Heating," Fifth Avenue
